member.name: DDDEVICEIDENTIFIER2
member.summary: The DDDEVICEIDENTIFIER2 structure is passed to the method to obtain information about a device.

summary.para: Version of the driver. It is valid to do less than and greater than comparisons on all 64 bits. Caution should be exercised if you use this element to identify problematic drivers; instead, use the guidDeviceIdentifier member for this purpose.
The data takes the following form:
summary.code: wProduct = HIWORD(liDriverVersion.HighPart) wVersion = LOWORD(liDriverVersion.HighPart) wSubVersion = HIWORD(liDriverVersion.LowPart) wBuild = LOWORD(liDriverVersion.LowPart)

member.name: DDDEVICEIDENTIFIER2.dwVendorId
member.summary: Identifier of the manufacturer. Can be 0 if unknown.

member.name: DDDEVICEIDENTIFIER2.dwDeviceId
member.summary: Identifier of the type of chipset. Can be 0 if unknown.

member.name: DDDEVICEIDENTIFIER2.dwSubSysId
member.summary: Identifier of the subsystem. Typically, this means the particular board. Can be 0 if unknown.

member.name: DDDEVICEIDENTIFIER2.dwRevision
member.summary: Identifier of the revision level of the chipset. Can be 0 if unknown.

member.name: DDDEVICEIDENTIFIER2.guidDeviceIdentifier
member.summary: Unique identifier for the driver and chipset pair. Use this value if you want to track changes to the driver or chipset to reprofile the graphics subsystem. It can also be used to identify particular problematic drivers.

member.name: DDDEVICEIDENTIFIER2.dwWHQLLevel
member.summary: The Windows Hardware Quality Lab (WHQL) certification level for the device and driver pair.
